item.title: Bar Plots
item.description: Bar Plots are bar graphs. library(Lahman) library(ggplot2) library(sqldf) query<-"SELECT name,HR FROM Teams WHERE yearID=1980 ORDER BY HR" result<-sqldf(query) result$name<-factor(result$name, levels =result$name ) ggplot()+ geom_bar(data =result,aes(x=name, y=HR),stat= 'identity',color="blue",fill="white" )+ coord_flip()+ ylab("homeruns")+ xlab("team")+ ggtitle("1980 Team Homerun Distribution")

item.title: Histograms
item.description: Histograms are diagrams consisting of rectangles whose area is proportional to the frequency of a variable and whose width is equal to the class interval. library(Lahman) library(ggplot2) library(sqldf) query<-"SELECT weight FROM Master" result<-sqldf(query) ggplot()+ geom_histogram(data = result,aes(x=weight),color="blue",fill="white",bins=50)+ ggtitle("Body Weight Distribution for Baseball Players") ## Warning: Removed 854 rows containing non-finite values (stat_bin).

item.title: Scatter Plots
item.description: Scatter Plots are dots that represent data values. library(Lahman) library(ggplot2) library(sqldf) query<-"SELECT playerID,sum(HR) AS career_HR, sum(SO) AS career_SO FROM Batting GROUP BY playerID HAVING sum(HR)>=400" result<-sqldf(query) ggplot()+ geom_point(data=result,aes(x=career_SO,y=career_HR),size= 3,color="blue")+ ggtitle("Career Strikeouts VS Homeruns for Great Hitters")+ xlab("Career Strikeouts")+ ylab("Career Homeruns")

item.title: Time Series
item.description: A time series is a series of values of a value obtained at different times. library(Lahman) library(ggplot2) library(sqldf) query<-"SELECT yearID,HR FROM Batting WHERE playerID='ruthba01'" result<-sqldf(query) ggplot()+ geom_line(data = result,aes(x=yearID,y=HR))+ ggtitle("Ruth's Homerun Titles Throughout the Years")+ xlab("Year")+ ylab("Homeruns")

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
